project_description: A simple Flutter application that switches text between 'Cat' and 'Dog' with respective icons when clicked.
architecture_overview: This Flutter project follows a clean architecture approach, utilizing the Cubit pattern for state management. The app has one screen and utilizes a single Cubit to manage the state of the displayed text and icon.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> HomeScreen: click text
HomeScreen -> AnimalCubit: toggleAnimal()
AnimalCubit -> AnimalState: update state
AnimalCubit --> HomeScreen: new state
HomeScreen -> AnimalDisplay: update UI
@enduml
state_management_flow: State is managed using the Cubit pattern. The AnimalCubit toggles the state between 'Cat' and 'Dog' when the text is clicked. The HomeScreen listens to state changes and updates the AnimalDisplay widget accordingly.
navigation_flow: The app has a single screen, HomeScreen, which displays the AnimalDisplay widget. There is no navigation between different screens.
